alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 18 at 3:00PM CDT until March 18 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Dale County in southeastern Alabama... Southwestern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Houston County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 300 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Daleville, Dothan, Headland, Ozark, Fort Rucker, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Level Plains, Cowarts, Newton, Webb, Pinckard, Clayhatchee, Grimes, Avon, Napier Field, Currytown and Kelly Springs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
